result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown not in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown not in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown.  Attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of Brown County cases 18CF645 & 19CF1063. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Hunter. State rests.  Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Rebecca I. Ferguson-Brown, Milwaukee County Jail - Pod 6D/Cell 16, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. Case adjourned due to SPD not appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AH (DOB 1/20/21)

Defendant Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rebecca I Ferguson-Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
